intro: Calotis scabiosifolia var. cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved calotis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in dry, sunny conditions. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in umbels, giving it a delicate appearance. It is often found in coastal and inland regions, contributing to local biodiversity.
